topic: Is HBM pricing power sustainable through 2028?

roles.label: Demand Analyst
roles.brief: AI training/inference demand trajectories, hyperscaler capex cycles, workload mix evolution

roles.label: Supply & Yield Analyst
roles.brief: HBM manufacturing yields, capacity additions, fab economics, supplier capex discipline

roles.label: Architecture Analyst
roles.brief: Memory hierarchy design, HBM alternatives (GDDR7, system DRAM), inference optimization, compute-memory ratios

roles.label: Competition & Packaging Analyst
roles.brief: Chinese HBM entrants, advanced packaging bottlenecks (CoWoS), substrate supply, market structure

decisiveAssumptions: Whether the training-vs-inference mix shift reduces total HBM demand growth rate as inference workloads scale
Whether hyperscaler capex growth sustains at 25%+ annually through 2028 or moderates on ROI pressure
Whether inference workloads architect around HBM via system DRAM substitution (e.g. Microsoft Maia 200 approach)
Whether MoE, sparsity, and quantization decouple model parameter scaling from proportional HBM consumption
Whether HBM4 yield rates at Samsung close the gap with SK Hynix, adding effective capacity without new fabs
Whether memory suppliers maintain capex discipline or overbuild into a classic DRAM cycle bust
Whether CoWoS and advanced packaging capacity scales faster than HBM supply, removing the co-bottleneck
Whether Chinese HBM producers (CXMT) reach production quality and meaningful market share by 2027

topic: Should public companies adopt Bitcoin as a treasury reserve asset?

roles.label: Market Dynamics Analyst
roles.brief: Bitcoin volatility regime, liquidity depth, correlation to risk assets, price floor mechanisms

roles.label: Regulatory & Accounting Analyst
roles.brief: FASB fair-value rules, crypto custody regulation, tax treatment of unrealized gains, SEC guidance

roles.label: Institutional Adoption Analyst
roles.brief: CFO risk tolerance, board governance, corporate bond market repricing, insurance/pension fund mandates

roles.label: Macro & Sovereign Analyst
roles.brief: Nation-state reserve adoption, dollar debasement thesis, geopolitical hedging, monetary policy interaction

decisiveAssumptions: Whether Bitcoin 90-day realized volatility drops below 40% sustained, making balance sheet exposure tolerable for CFOs
Whether FASB fair-value accounting creates earnings volatility that punishes BTC-holding companies in equity markets
Whether sovereign adoption by 3+ nation-states creates a credible price floor and legitimization dynamic
Whether corporate bond markets reprice credit risk upward for companies with >10% BTC treasury allocation
Whether regulatory clarity on qualified crypto custody removes the operational barrier for institutional treasurers
Whether BTC correlation to risk assets stays high during drawdowns, negating the diversification thesis
Whether shareholder activism forces companies to mark-to-market BTC holdings quarterly, creating forced selling pressure
Whether stablecoin/CBDC adoption undercuts Bitcoin's monetary premium by offering regulated digital dollar alternatives

Whether energy and power delivery constraints cap cluster sizes before algorithmic limits are reached
Whether emergent capabilities plateau at a specific parameter regime or continue appearing unpredictably
Whether benchmarks saturate before real-world task performance plateaus, masking continued scaling gains

topic: Will AI automate more than 30% of white-collar knowledge work within 5 years?

roles.label: AI Capability Analyst
roles.brief: Hallucination rates, reliability thresholds, edge case handling, task complexity limits

roles.label: Enterprise Adoption Analyst
roles.brief: Deployment cycles, integration costs, mid-market penetration, change management friction

roles.label: Labor Market Analyst
roles.brief: Retraining timelines, union responses, regulatory intervention, wage dynamics

roles.label: Economic Structure Analyst
roles.brief: Productivity paradox, augmentation vs replacement, task redefinition, measurement methodology

decisiveAssumptions: Whether AI reliability (hallucination rates) reaches thresholds acceptable for regulated industries (legal, medical, financial)
Whether AI handles judgment calls and edge cases, not just routine pattern-matched tasks
Whether enterprise adoption cycles compress from typical 3-5 years to under 2 years for AI tools
Whether mid-market firms (not just tech giants) adopt AI tools at meaningful scale within the window
Whether labor market friction (retraining programs, union contracts, regulation) slows deployment regardless of capability
Whether AI augmentation increases per-worker productivity enough that firms hire more rather than fewer workers
Whether the definition of 'knowledge work' shifts to exclude newly automated tasks, making 30% a moving target
Whether displacement is measured by tasks eliminated vs. roles eliminated, as these produce very different numbers
